data.title: How were the Greeks able to win against the Persians if they had no cavalry?
data.meta_description:
Answer: As Richard Holmes pointed out in The Oxford Companion to Military History, the Greek victory over the Persians occurred because in the de decisive battles, the Greeks were able to fight in terrain suitable to their heavy infantry and not suitable to cavalry.
